title: Meta Enforces Disclosure Policy for AI-Altered Political Ads
originSummary: Meta, the social media giant, has announced a policy requiring political advertisers to disclose if and when they utilise third-party artificial intelligence (AI) software to artificially represent individuals and events in ads.
Starting next year, the policy will also ban advertisers from utilizing Meta's in-house AI software to generate political or social issue advertisements.
Ads made using AI that do not disclose AI involvement will be rejected. This move follows extensive criticism over inadequate political ad monitoring on Meta's platforms.
commentSummary: Meta, the social media conglomerate, has put forth a new policy requiring political advertisers to disclose if they have used third-party AI software to artificially illustrate people and events in ads.
From next year, this policy will also ban advertisers from using Meta's AI-assisted software to produce political or social issue ads.
Any ads that are modified using AI and fail to disclose this will be declined. This update occurs in response to widespread criticism of Meta's oversight on political advertising.

title: AI's Prominent Role in Enhancing Quality, Safety, and Cybersecurity in the Automotive Industry
originSummary: AI can greatly benefit the automotive industry by implementing mechanisms like predictive maintenance, which anticipates and rectifies potential issues before they occur.
The use of AI for end-of-line inspection allows the prediction and prevention of manufacturing faults in real-time, minimizing costly plant downtime.
Anomaly detection in vehicles can enhance their cybersecurity by flagging suspicious activities to engineers. However, recent political actions have aimed to restrict the use and scope of AI.
commentSummary: AI has several positive impacts on the automotive industry, including predictive maintenance to identify and mitigate potential malfunctions before they happen.
The technology can also use past manufacturing failure data in real time to predict and prevent issues, thus reducing expensive downtime in production plants.
AI can flag suspicious behavior in vehicles, strengthening cybersecurity and making cars safer. However, recent political actions may limit AI's scope and use in these areas.

title: Meta Mandates Disclosure of AI-Generated Contents in Political Ads; Rule to Take Effect in 2024
originSummary: Meta, Facebook and Instagram's parent company, revealed a new policy that mandates advertisers to disclose AI-produced or digitally modified content in political, electoral, and social issue ads.

The policy, expected to be put into effect by 2024, pertains to "realistic," misleadingly represented actions or occurrences. Minor edits, like cropping or color rectifications, need not be disclosed.
The policy follows Meta's earlier resolution barring political campaigns from using AI ad tools and is precedes anticipated regulatory measures from lawmakers and the Federal Election Commission.
commentSummary: Meta, the company behind Facebook and Instagram, has introduced a policy that mandates advertisers to reveal AI-produced or digitally manipulated content in political, electoral, and societal issue advertisements.

Set to initiate in 2024, this guideline targets "realistic" content inaccurately representing someone's activities or situations. Minor or insignificant adjustments, like cropping or colour editing, do not require disclosure.
This policy follows Meta's previous ban on political campaigns using its AI ad tools, and anticipates forthcoming laws from legislators and the Federal Election Commission.

title: Chinese President Urges Global Unity in Addressing AI Challenges, Fails to Address Internet Controls
originSummary: In a speech at the World Internet Conference Summit, Chinese President Xi Jinping urged global cooperation to address potential risks posed by artificial intelligence (AI), indicating China's increasing control over online free speech.
Xi emphasized China's dedication to promoting the safe development of AI, and working with other nations to improve the safety, fairness, and reliability of AI technology.
This announcement comes post the launch of the Global AI Governance Initiative by China, a call-out for an open and competitive environment for AI's advancement.
commentSummary: Chinese President Xi Jinping has called for global collaboration to mitigate the possible risks posed by AI technologies, emphasizing this in his speech at the World Internet Conference Summit.
Xi's call aligns with China's recent focus on advancing safe AI practices and ensuring its reliability and fairness.
Last month, China had also launched the Global AI Governance Initiative to promote an unbiased and open environment for AI development.

title: Meta Mandates Advertisers to Reveal AI Usage in Content Manipulation for Political Ads
originSummary: Meta, Facebook's parent company, will mandate advertisers to disclose when they use AI for content manipulation in political ads, both on Facebook and Instagram.
Advertisements modified using AI for content fabrication will be saved in Meta's Ad Library and not informing about AI alterations could lead to ad denial and penalties.

This policy, which will take effect in the new year, does not apply to AI alterations linked to image and video quality or ads relating to potentially sensitive areas such as housing, employment, health, and politics.
commentSummary: Meta, Facebook's parent company, will be mandating advertisers to disclose when they utilize artificial intelligence (AI) for content manipulation in political ads on platforms Facebook and Instagram.

This policy omits the need for disclosure when AI is simply used to enhance image and video quality, and ensures against undisclosed AI intervention in ad creation by archiving manipulated ads in Meta's Ad Library.

The policy, taking effect from the next year, imposes penalties and the possibility of ad rejection for non-disclosure, but excludes ads relevant to sensitive areas such as housing, employment, health, and politics.

title: Samsung Introduces Gauss, a Generative AI Model for Its Devices, Surpassing Apple in Implementation
originSummary: Samsung has launched Samsung Gauss, a new generative artificial intelligence model, for AI applications on its devices, potentially overtaking Apple in this field.
The Gauss model includes a generative language feature for composing emails and translating content, a quick code writing tool for software developers, and an image generation and editing tool.
Samsung's goal is to integrate Gauss into a variety of products to enrich the user experience across its product line.
commentSummary: Samsung has unveiled a new generative AI model, Samsung Gauss, aimed at implementing AI applications on its devices, potentially making it a pioneer in bringing generative AI to consumer electronics.
Gauss includes functionalities such as composing emails, translating content, aiding software developers in quick code writing, and an image generation/editing feature.
Samsung plans to incorporate Gauss across its product range to improve user experience.

title: Amazon Invests Millions in Training 'Olympus', a Rival to Top AI Models
originSummary: Amazon is investing millions in a large language model (LLM) called "Olympus," which is expected to compete with leading models from OpenAI and Alphabet.

The model, potentially one of the largest trained with approximately two trillion parameters, is being spearheaded by Rohit Prasad, former Alexa head and current artificial general intelligence chief scientist at Amazon.

Amazon's goal is to foster homegrown models to draw more users to its cloud-based platform, Amazon Web Services. Prior to this, Amazon has already trained smaller models and collaborated with AI startups.
commentSummary: Amazon is reportedly focusing on a significant investment in a large language model (LLM) called "Olympus," aiming it to compete with leading models from OpenAI and Alphabet.

Olympus is likely to be one of the biggest trained models with approximately two trillion parameters. The project is being spearheaded by Rohit Prasad, former Alexa head and current chief scientist of artificial general intelligence at Amazon.
By partnering with AI startups and training smaller models, Amazon intends to rise in the artificial intelligence segment and attract more users to its Amazon Web Services (AWS).

title: Meta Announces Mandatory Disclosure for AI-Altered Content in Political Ads from 2024
originSummary: Meta, Facebook and Instagram's parent company, has established new regulations for the use of AI-generated content in political ads starting 2024.

Advertisers are required to disclose if AI was utilized to generate or modify footage in a way that significantly impacts the ad's message or statements. Failure to comply may result in ad rejection and penalties.
This change is in response to increasing concerns regarding deceptive AI-created content in electoral campaigns and impending legislation aimed at curbing its misuse.
commentSummary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, has announced new regulations concerning the use of AI-generated content in political advertisements starting from 2024.
The new policy requires advertisers to disclose when AI has been employed to create or significantly manipulate footage within an ad, affecting the ad's message or claims.

Ads that fail to comply with these disclosures will face rejection and possible penalties, marking Meta's crucial step in addressing increasing concerns over deceptive AI-generated content in election campaigns.

title: Supermicro Outshines IonQ in Stock Investment Potential, Despite IonQ's High Revenue Growth Predictions, Says The Motley Fool
originSummary: The Motley Fool, a financial and investment guidance service, has two main services called Stock Advisor and Rule Breakers that have shown high returns.
AI server company Supermicro saw a 37% revenue increase in 2023 and expects a 54% increase in 2024 due to a partnership with Nvidia, a leading GPU and AI tech firm.

Quantum computing company IonQ plans to enhance its processing power and scale, anticipating a 73% revenue growth in 2023. However, The Motley Fool prefers Supermicro for investment considering its scalability, profitability, and affordability.
commentSummary: The Motley Fool, a financial and investment advice service, reports high returns from its primary services, Stock Advisor and Rule Breakers.

AI server company Supermicro experienced a 37% revenue increase in 2023 and expects a 54% growth in 2024, partially as a result of a partnership with Nvidia, a prominent graphics processing units (GPUs) manufacturer.

IonQ, a quantum computing company, anticipates enhancing its processing power and business scale with a projected 73% revenue growth in 2023. Yet, The Motley Fool considers Supermicro a better investment for its scalability, profitability, and affordability.
